intro: Pilosella calodon, commonly known as the slender pearly everlasting, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry meadows and rocky soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its foliage is covered in fine, white hairs, giving it a soft, silvery appearance. The flowers are small and yellowish-white, often appearing in clusters, and bloom from late spring to early summer.
